title: @RiotRepertior Since the Urgot rework is coming (as you have teased), can you confirm something?
body:
I am an Urgot player, and the last thing I want is for Urgot to be relaunched.

He fills a very unique niche.

He isn't like Sion, Poppy, or Yorick before him.

His "Identity Crisis" is more of a publicity thing than anything else.

Urgot is not a marksman; not at all. Urgot is a Tank: but not in the sense of a "damage soaker". Urgot is like an ACTUAL tank. Firing long ranged shit and tearing the enemy a new one, and is durable enough stroll right through the enemy lines, but is normally slow as hell.

Some might argue that his ult doesn't fit with that description, and it doesn't, but it strays from the fantasy in a pretty funny way.

In a teamfight, his ult is like a Tank falling out of the sky to kick ass.

Imagine this: the enemy ADC and support are just casually walking through the jungle, when suddenly...

{{champion:6}}  "SUP, BITCHES?"
https://youtu.be/104tQfcK1sI?t=2m44s

tl;dr
I want to know if Urgot is going to retain his status as an M1 Abrams tank with a habit of teleporting on top of people.

What we need is not this,
http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Chw7bWuVraE/U7NPsom_CUI/AAAAAAAAS3s/oXqr6HyrPa4/s1600/malpite.png

not this,
http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Caitlyn_5.jpg

but this
http://i.imgur.com/2qxVaRS.gif

The riot given definition of a tank

> Focus on being tough and difficult to kill, while usually dealing less damage than other champions. They often have abilities with crowd-control (stuns, slows, etc), and generally have low mobility.

source: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/new-player-guide#/champions/roles?_k=qtyiin

Lets see, the only hard and fast requirement for a "Tank" is a focus on durability. Everything else is listed as "usually", "often", or "generally", indicating exceptions.

In any case, lets see how our favorite Purple hulk fares.
Tough? One of the toughest.
Unexceptional Damage? Eh, he does a lot for a tank, but pales in comparison to champs like Jinx or Vayne.
CC? Not much, just a slow, but it's there.
Low mobility? He has a decent movement speed buff, but nothing that screams "Sanic Speeds".

Urgot's ultimate is the most interesting (and most powerful) spell in his entire kit.

At max rank, it gives:
An 850 range, 1 second suppression.
5 seconds of 50% damage reduction.
A 3 second, 40% slow.
A 1.5 second AOE fear.
1 second of no unit collision.
Of course, the position swap.

It is an incredible skill that can change the course of a teamfight. It is also great in duels (Unless you are fighting Vayne, Fiora, or Irelia, but meh. Busting through reduction is their thing).

When you can pull it off, it feels great; along the lines of a good Hecarim ult, except this feels great even after the CC is over.

While it wouldn't work on a marksman, it DOES work on Urgot, because Urgot is NOT a marksman.

Removing such an awesome skill for another of something that we have had a lot of (steroids are very common in league) is just bad design.

Also, Battlecast Urgot is close enough to a "Tank" skin that he is unlikely to get one that is explicitly a tank.

He is a ranged, physical DPS champion, yet is not a marksman. He has artillery, yet likes to dive headlong into the enemy ranks to kill them up close and personal. He is ranged, yet is very durable. He is a walking mess of contradictions, and his playerbase (small as it may be) loves it.

3. No. Urgot is, has been, and (hopefully) always will be, a tanky-ranged-bruiser-artillery monstrosity.

4. Yeah, and while we are at it, why not replace Mordekaiser's ult with a movement speed boost? Or replace Nunu's Q with a stun? Those champions both could use those things put somewhere in their kit, and certainly not a single person would get pissed that a core part of what makes their champion unique is being completely removed. /s

If anything was to get changed, I'd say his Passive and E are the best candidates.
His passive is strong, but just feels like invisible power.
His E by itself feels really weak, but is made strong by its interaction with Q. It really needs to feel like its own spell.
If E got changed, Q would be changed by extension, I suppose.

Ranged bruisers CAN be balanced; Urgot, Swain, Teemo (with the mallet build), and Gnar are all ranged bruisers who are at a pretty acceptable power level. Yes, these champions have been problematic in the past, but they have been fixed so that no one would really say they are OP anymore. Even Graves, who is incredibly frustrating to play against, has seen enough nerfs that he is manageable with some coordination.

What sort of passive are we wanting though? The current one acts like a Phantom Dancer.

Do we want item dependency? If so, we could run with a passive that scales off bonus AD or even bonus health. Heck, could even have something along the lines of 5% of Bonus Health added to Bonus AD.

Or we could really glass cannon things. Pull a mix of Cassiopeia and Jhin. Urgot does not gain additional health. All bonus health is instead converted to resistances, AD or both.

His current passive is honestly fine. It is very powerful, but it just doesn't feel impactful.

Hell, they might be able to leave its mechanics identical, and just add some more noticeable visuals.

The first passive is mediocre. Not horrible, but Urgot doesn't exactly like to stack HP.
The second one is just terrible. Urgot is durable; that is one of his main things. Even though stacking HP isn't his thing, removing his ability to get ANY bonus HP, even if it was compensated with resistances, wouldn't work, since stacking armor/MR gets less powerful the more you get. The moment you locked in Urgot, the enemy would just pick Yi and Irelia, and then you would have no way to deal with them.

But Bruiser Graves is the biggest waste of his power.

And Urgot looks like a fat metal monster, him being squishy always left a bad taste in my mouth.  I hope they make him so building a few tank items on him is the way to go.

I thought of making a post along the lines of Urgot's important abilities. But I will post some thoughts here. 

The one ability I believe should stay is his R, Hyper-Kinetic-Position-Reverser. Why?

Please go to where Urgot is on the battlecast link. Notice, he is listed as a SHOCK TROOPER.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/skin-release/battlecast-skins

A shock trooper is one who mobilizes very quickly to penetrate the back lines on an enemy formation. Sometimes armour (tanks) would be used to support such an operation. 

All it takes is 1 second for an Urgot to expose a weakness in an enemy formation and reek havoc on the backlines. This strategy can be very risky which is perfect for a champion who in former life gave very little thought of his own well being in battle. A true Noxian. 

To be candid, Urgot's Q and E were the causation for nerfs and unfair gameplay. Too much range and damage for an ability combo that guarantees too much safety and results if it lands. 

**I propose that that Urgot keep his ultimate and some kind of shield. **

----

Now, how is Urgot different than Sion (this will lead into other parts of his kit, I promise)?

Sion and Urgot are similar in that they were both physical and fearless warriors on the battlegrounds who wouldn't surrender even at the cost of their own life.

They differed starkly in reanimation, however. Sion was captured and cleanly executed while Urgot had suffered years of abuse and then a rather grotesque and sloppy cut that tore him in two. 

We see what it took for Sion, some metal fittings, a furnace to enhance his potency, a missing leg sure, but most of him still intact. Thus he can wield his large man-sized axe and crush those like he did in days of old and glory (with some extra benefits). 

Urgot on the other hand could not be brought back by necromancy alone. He needed some new body to be fashioned to house the spiteful and resilient spirit of Urgot. In comes Zaun.  

And with Urgot being given a new body by Zaun, it only makes sense he would have new tools of destruction. 

I feel he should have at least a long range ability and have an auto ranged attack, and the rapid firing of Q is interesting. To me it is far more badass and thematically fitting to think of Urgot as one who will charge in and cause pandemonium. 

Furthermore, with a more unifying model, one that causes true discomfort and revulsion, this would be a champion that you would want to keep off your back lines, and he would look the part. 

An undead shock trooper, cybernetically enhanced that causes the normal soldier to become weak-kneed praying to which ever gods they do "asking how such an unnameable perversion could be allowed to walk the soil". The wheezing pulp of rotund, carrion flesh, covered in his opponents blood; never stopping, never lamenting his actions, filled with singular purpose, that is, to be a war machine and never let death take that from him again.   

------

His passive should be changed as well. It lacks interaction for both players and is invisible stats. 

So his Passive and E, or it's functionality should change. No more damage reduction and lock on missiles. 

His voice should be heavily filtered and his model should create a new definition of "unwholesomeness". 

TL:DR

P "Zaun..." - Replace

Q "Acid Hunter"  - Keep/Tweak   (Get rid of the scythe, clashes with high tech theme)

W "Terror Capacitor" - Keep

E "Noxian..." -Replace/Tweak

R "Hyper..." - KEEP!!!  (This is one of the most variable, risk/reward/, engaging (for both teams) ability in the game is the reason I love playing him so much).
He's the Bastion of League, not a tank in the sense of role but an actual tank
